page.title: 16SHEEP IN HOOK GRAVEYARD
page.content: This summer has seen considerable local comment on sheep being used to trim grass in the village graveyard. The story has been in both local and national newspapers and there have been heated interviews on radio and television.The sheep were moved into the churchyard by the Parochial Church Council. Many villagers have said the sheep have damaged graves and eaten flowers.Mr Don Graham,whose family has lived in Hook for over 30 years, and has his father buried there has threatened to take the matter to the Bishop of Winchester.Eventually the sheep were moved out but churchwarden Mr John Morgan has hinted they may be brought back next year as they were a cheap way to keep the grass down.Since the arrival of the sheep numbers of tended graves have apparently gone up from 5 to 23!
